title: How to get copyrights before publishing my first book - Quora

response.answer_text: Once your book is published, it is automatically copyrighted. The publishers develop a copyright page where the copyright is either given to the author or the publisher, depending on the contract made. In case of self-publishing, copyright always remains with the author. If you want to get your work registered with the government, your publishing service provider can get you one with a small fee but it takes lot of time to get it registered. If your work is not a scientific research or any kind of thesis papers, getting your work published and owning a copyright page would suffice. Happy Writing!
A written work is copyrighted as soon as it is reduced to writing. If you wish to have registration of your copyright you submit it to the copyright office. Publication is not required.
